There's only a short OWC warranty, and I have no idea if it was returned because it was broken, and if so, whether it was actually fixed or just boxed and resold. Review.Titre: Completely non-functioning Mac Pro was sent to me
Review.Contenu: Mac pro was sent out without ever conducting any quality checks on it at all. It didn't detect any hard drive and now I am having to send it back after I spent money overnighting it to my house.

If you use this LCD adhesive kit, wish you never have to open your iMac again. Apple's adhesive strips can be sliced in the middle quite easily with the "pizza cutter" sold by OWC. No so these strips nor the long ones that come (or used to come) with the HD/SSD upgrade kits. The material is just too thin and dense, I even had difficulty cutting the long ones width-wise with a utility knife, after breaking both the wheel and the other end of the pizza cutter and cracking my screen.Also, being generic little 4-inch strips, you can't cover the corners, and you have to be careful to identify the microphone holes in advance to avoid covering them.###Update after MacSales' reply.First of all, my review has been censored and doesn't appear on the product's page. Shame on you.Then, a search for glue, adhesive, strips, or directly in the Tools & Toolkits section doesn't show any long strips other than those coming with another item, on the Canadian site (yes on the American site).Third, I hold you totally responsible for the fact my microphone wasn't working after installing my SSD last May. Both strips for the iMac 27" 2019 have the same length at the bottom, but the microphone holes are off-center and the strip covered them. I only discovered this fact after finding a comment about it on the Internet. At that point I had tested that the microphone was working after opening the iMac, but not after putting the new strips, so I thought something was wrong with the connector, and trying to repeatedly fix the cable in it more damage ensued and now the microphone is definitely not working and I had to buy an external one. I hate you.And finally, as I said originally, the material used for the long strips is not of Apple's quality. When I tried to cut it with the wheel, all it did was either unglue it totally from one side (OK, I guess, but not very reassuring) or push it further inside and put the display in danger, as I painfully discovered when the screen cracked.###Update after MacSales' 2nd reply.I did watch the video when I installed the SSD in May, that one:installvideos/imac_27in5k_14late_hdd/iMac19-1/At 7:53 the guy installs the bottom strips, but there is no mention of the microphone holes. Worse, as I already said, the strips are not suitable to avoid covering the holes.The computer in the video is not a 2019 model, as the video connector is not located at the same place, and I don't see the microphone connector and cable on the motherboard board (at 8:50). Maybe the microphone is near the camera.You're not even acknowledging that the product is defective and that heretofore you'll offer a corrected version (or one really suitable for the 2019). I was perfectly able to handle the complexity of the original operation, and everything would have been fine were it not for the inappropriate product (size- and material-wise).Of course I will not have the computer repaired nor ever opened again (except to get the SSD when I scrap it in a few years), the small strips are probably as unremovable as the long ones, if not more.Please do not reply. Conversation over.

You guys gave a packed empty container of adhesion fluid which was supposed to be used to remove gum behind the battery. I had purchase that additionally from local shop in-order to replace the battery.

Review.Titre: Bought a macbook pro which is DOA Dead On Arrival
Review.Contenu: I spent around $1100 and bought a MacBook Pro and several other items. All other items are bought based on the main item, Apple Macbook. But the MacBook Pro does not work on the first day of arrival and it is Dead on Arrival. I am very upset and think that I should have bought the same from somewhere else. I sent it back to them and my order was made on Nov 21, 2023. As of today, it's 17 days and I don't have any new computer to work on. I thought of buying more Macs from them. It entirely depends on how OWC macsales handles this. Will update you later on how it goes. For me quality of the product matters, I don't expect Dead On Arrival.Dec 11, 2023:-OWC :- Regarding the Eclipse plan, that program is set where as the start date for the warranty window begins on the original invoice date. Regrettably, this date is not changeable in the systemMe :- So even though OWC sent the product the Dead On Arrival, they will not accept their mistake.OWC Return Policy:-For return requests within 14 days from the original invoice date (ship date of the order):A small $25 fee will be applied.Or a 15% fee will be applied to:New or refurbished factory-sealed Mac that has been opened / unsealed.If your return is received after your return deadline but within 24 days of you original invoice.For return requests within 15-30 days from the original invoice date (ship date of the order):A 15% fee will be applied.Or a 25% fee (up to rejection of the return) will be applied to:New or refurbished factory-sealed Mac that has been opened / unsealed.Returns received damaged, incomplete, missing contents or missing original OWC / retail box.If your return is received after your return deadline. OWC (12/11/2023, 3:14:25 PM): this is for Macs OWC (12/11/2023, 3:14:51 PM): this is for the other items OWC (12/11/2023, 3:14:52 PM): Orders cancelled after processing (order has been placed, invoiced and/or shipped) AND unopened items are subject to a 5% restocking fee. Excludes custom, bulk and Modbook orders. Refused shipments are subject to return freight charges.Opened items are subject to a 15% restocking fee.All refunds will be processed based on the following:Goods received complete WITHIN 15 days of the original invoice date will receive a refund minus all applicable restocking fees (as noted above) of the invoiced purchase price.Goods received complete AFTER 15 days, but WITHIN 30 days of the original invoice date, will receive the lesser of either the current selling price on the day the item is delivered to our warehouse or the original price as noted on the invoice.

Review.Contenu: Have been a customer for many years, so I was surprised and perplexed about such a basic miscue as shipping a computer without a power chord. Hope my return  and refund are promptly addressed.

Review.Titre: 50% defective products, no matter the cost
Review.Contenu: We've used them for two decades now, but they ship us defective items 50% of the time, it can be over 2k or 15k, or a cheap item, it is always the same; the quality is hit or miss, and half items they send cannot be used AT ALL. And NO improvement over 20 years! Tech help just tries to stall returns, they know the products are defective and have no solutions. If we didn't have Macs and could order from anyone else, we would, but we have a contract at the school and have no choice. So if you do have a choice, make a smart one and avoid this company and save yourself a lot of headaches, time and probably a lot of money. Seriously, only HALF their products are functional, the rest are non-functioning.

Review.Titre: I had items in my cart
Review.Contenu: I had items in my cart.  Because you can't register until you make purchase they dissappeared and when I went back in the prices for my purchases went up within a day by about $50.  Wasn't happy about that at all.

Review.Titre: Web communication not working- have to phone
Review.Contenu: No shipping or message explaining delay even though the items were ALL in stock and the website cannot find a record of my order with the number in the confirmation along with the postal code.

Purchased a refurbished dock from this company, within a few months the thubderbolt port started disconnecting. I contacted support and ended up doing an rma, I paid for shipping and insurance. When they received the dock, they waited for me to contact them after I should have received it back. They then come up with some bs telling me the SD card slot is damaged and my warranty is no good. I never even used the SD card slot. Basicly they sold me a faulty refurbished product, lied to me told me the thubderbolt port would be covered under warranty(I checked the saved transcripts) then decide to not bother contacting me back once I mail it in for repair.

Ordered an external drive, combination hdd and sdd. Order said, “In stock, ships today!” Nothing happened for several days, with no communication. I finally asked them and was told they are looking at 10 business days due to supply chain issues. I canceled the order.

Review.Titre: This company sent me refurbished gear…
Review.Contenu: This company sent me refurbished gear under the guise of a sale. They use some other word for refurbished but it doesn’t even come in the apple packaging. The speakers were delivered in a box, and instruction packet and some second hand charger. Complete rip off. It wasn’t until one of the HomePods didn’t work, that I realized I was swindled. Be careful.

Item listed as new, in bulk packaging. Arrived clearly used and set up by someone elseResponse: when you test products, do you set them up with your personal Apple account? Because that’s what happened. Do you remove the protective film on the device itself as well as the charger? If you’re doing all of that stuff, it’s not new, even if you’re the ones doing it.Second response: I just realized that the box you sent me says it's "as is", not new. I'm pretty sure y'all shipped me a used homepod by accident. I'm going to call up.

Review.Titre: What happened to my order C6652475-Q0001?
Review.Contenu: I placed an order on Sep 1st. The order number is C6652475-Q0001. I have not received my order and I have repeatedly searched for my order status (the web page for the item said "ships the same day") and have only been told that the order can't be found. I have received no update that it is out of stock, just silence from your company. The web page is still saying "ships the same day", that's misleading and false advertising. What is your company going to do about it?

Review.Titre: Selling parts they do not have in stock
Review.Contenu: I ordered sd memory for my mac only to find out 3 weeks later, after contacting support to inquire about delivery, that the product I ordered was out os stock.It was a waste of time, Nd very frustrating experience for me. If you don’t have it, dont sell it!!!

I ordered a new external storage solution with an hdd and ssd ($1500). When ordered, it said “In stock, ships today!” After a week of no communication on the order from anyone I asked them about it. I was told they were looking at 10 business days as they await the ssd component. I canceled the order. Untrustworthy and poor communication. I would not recommend them, despite the glowing reviews. This was my first (and last) order from this company.

Review.Titre: Next day delivery doesn't mean next day
Review.Contenu: Paid extra for next day delivery. It's been 2 days and the order just says pending? No tracking or shipped email. Called customer service and they couldn't help or provide insights on the situation.
Charged my credit card, and then cancelled my order saying they couldn’t verify card details.  Asked me to use some other form of payment after my card had already been charged.  Stay away.

Watch out. I placed an order on Sep 1 for an item that still says "ships the same day" on its order page. I have not received my item and have NOT received any notice from the company. Status check says order can't be found. If the item is on back order then the "ships the same day" message STILL on the item's page eleven days later is misleading and false advertising. Will not do business again with this company, they are not to be trusted.

Review.Titre: Paid extra for 2nd day delivery. Still no product
Review.Contenu: Paid extra for 2nd day delivery.Est delivery date was 8/23.Called your customer service, spoke to Johnathon on 8/24. He stated some from your team would reach out to FedEx. And reply would reply with a email. Neither one of which has happened.He also expressed a refund would be issued for my charges for expedited shipping, that too has not happened.Need to find out the status of this order

Review.Titre: Day 6 - Money Taken - No Info !? Nobody on the case ?
Review.Contenu: Preparing for the biggest computer system upgrade to my business in 14 years. Lots of planning and huge expense. Key to this upgrade is the external high speed storage and receiving this device as a priority to the new system being set up. After months of considering and advice - OWC seem to be the best (used them many times before) - Primary purchase is this device - checked the online store and confirm 2 in stock - pay £4,000 for it including expedited FedEx courier . . payment taken and receipt . . Then nothing . . Four days later I use the online chat help - they’ll follow up .  Nothing ?! . . Later I call support on the phone . They’ll follow it up . . Nothing ?   Day Six today . . In this time, four other major suppliers of equipment from four other companies  have completed and delivered on the orders I made .  (Huge monitors, audio interfaces, apple gear etc ) after my OWC order was placed !?  Come on Mac-Sales !? This is appalling customer service ? How can you not know or not be bothered to follow up on my order !?

Review.Titre: Order sent to the wrong address as website is unclear!
Review.Contenu: My order is shipping to my billing address and not physical address. That part on your system was not clear in that respect. As it asked me give us your billing address if it is different than your address. And I did, and without telling me it is shipping it there. The problem is that my billing address is in another state. And that sucks. Totally sucks.

Review.Titre: The ordering process was spectacular - BUT...
Review.Contenu: The ordering process was spectacular. I really thought they did a great job. The product is not the greatest. It says it is supposed to be silent. And it's true there is no fan noise. But there is lots of clicking enough to disturb an audio even though this is positioned probably more than 3 feet from my microphone. Also the cables that connects it to the computer and also to power are far too short.Edit - Response to Other World Computing Response.Well it would have been better had you listed this on your site... especially if you knew this and could explain it here.Also the cables are painfully short, Both the cable to connect it to the computer and the power cable.Edit 2 - 2nd Response to Other World Computings Response to My Response. Again, the problem that I'm having here is that this is not really disclosed. Not clearly anyway. You absolutely understood that this drive is not completely silent. This could have been disclosed on your website. But you chose to hide that fact. You keep saying in your responses that the larger the hard drive the more the noise. But that is not set on your website. I challenge you to show that to me.And why should I have to buy longer cables when I'm already paying you for the drive in which they're included. These are ridiculously short being no more than maybe 2 feet long or so.Please stop making excuses. Put what you need to put on your website so that we could avoid this kind of thing in the future. Stop trying to respond here saying that there is an issue that you know about but you simply didn't inform me on your website.And you might also give a warning that you are choosing to include very short cables that likely will not be long enough for the majority of people and we may want to buy longer ones. Where upon I likely would not have made the purchase. That's kind of like saying, we will supply you with the car for X price. But a motor that actually works will cost more.Come on guys, you are better than this. I have bought from you for years and years. I really did enjoy the purchase experience. The rep was beyond fantastic. What a letdown when the unit actually arrived. You could have prepared me for this. You chose not to.Edit 3 - redacted for length.Edit 4 to Other World ComputingPerfect. If you can't take responsibility, then stop responding. Very good. But just to show you how nonsensical your response actually is… You do say on your website for this drive, that it is extremely quiet. So if you have room to say that, you could just add a couple of words to the effect that this drive while quiet does have some clicking sounds like all hard discs that spin have. Otherwise it is quieter than most. You could certainly say that. You do say that it's quiet. So rather than argue with me here and look like a fool, why not take responsibility. If you really care about this issue, I would like to talk with you. Provide me with a way to reach you.

Review.Titre: It's been a week ... not shipped yet?
Review.Contenu: It's been a week and my order has still not been shipped. As far as I can tell, this is because I chose the free shipping. From now on, I'll just mentally add $10 to your advertised prices to reflect the need to pay more for "shipping". For the most part, I really like your products. But service from MacSales has seriously deteriorated in the past ten years.
NO OPERATING MANUAL, CANNOT GET THE DISPLAY TO TURN ON, NOT COMPATABLE WITH MY MAC PRO.  NEED TO RETURN!  WASTE OF MONEY!
Don't understand how I can order Friday morning for next day air and they don't deliver it to UPS or Fedex for next day delivery. Paid all that extra and got it Monday evening.

Battery delivered already been used and returned By another customer. And it is not the plastic wrapping that is damaged, it is clear that the wrapping has been cut with and replaced. Company refused to return the product

Drive never showed up. Called 5 days later to be told you didn't have them to fill the raid and didn't notify us.Held back on the 2nd art of the order as a result. Charged me express post even though I never received the drives on time.

I am more than upset! I have a brand new Mac Mini and needed to purchase speakers.  I am a die hard Apple person and I really did not want a Mac Mini but it was a gift.   I purchases HOMEPOD mini to hook up and use as my speakers.   NO instructions, and the instructions say it is for iPads and iPhones!  BUT it was advertised as working for MacMini's!!!!! It will not connect via Bluetooth and I am angry that I wasted time and money on this. I will be calling the company tomorrow or Wednesday from California!
Still haven't received my order...Called and no one knows anything but they took my money no problem.

Review.Titre: I sold a nearly unused 2019 MacBook Pro…
Review.Contenu: I sold a nearly unused 2019 MacBook Pro maxed out machine, had it totally ready for a new user to start up and it has taken multiple weeks to just get to the point where the computer was finally confirmed as good, and the estimate was validated. Now I have been waiting more than a few days for the check that is supposed to arrive. I had previously sold a MacBook Pro, I thought to MacSales, and that went much more smoothly. Service has degraded, and what should have been a simple confirmation of a premium used machine that looked like new has taken a very long time, and the process is not yet complete becuase i do not have my check.

Review.Titre: The product is not the same as promoted
Review.Contenu: The product is not the same as an actual Mac charger. You very much gave the impression on your website that it was.It looks like Mac, but the cable is a lighter gage.  Hence, more prone to wear and overheating.Moreover, in using it, it warmed up. It didn't get hot, but my original Mac charged did not heat up. It was robust enough to easily handle the current.

Review.Titre: The rating was "very good" but there…
Review.Contenu: The rating was "very good" but there were much larger and more scratches than I would classify as "very good."  Also, it didn't boot when I received it.. It just kept looping in a constant boot process. I had to do a full factory reset and install and now it is booting as it should... I'm a bit worried now that this happened and don't have full confidence as I should.. I didn't think it would be difficult to expect an item to work as normal when I received it..  I tried to contact your "customer support" but that person said well it fits under your condition code as well it's working now isn't it?!?!  I was not happy with that response at all...

Review.Titre: PayPal in x4, it does not work from France! !
Review.Contenu: Despite 5 PayPal payment attempts in X4, via Safari + 1 last via Firefox, forced to pay in 1 installment, it's lamentable. Why announce the X4 PayPal when it doesn't work? No solution despite my multiple emails/signals! Unlikely to return to this site, especially if there are delivery problems! !

Review.Titre: I am not happy with this purchase at…
Review.Contenu: I am not happy with this purchase at all. It was a Black Friday or cyber Monday and so I was feeling under a time pressure and I didn’t read the fine print. I purchased an item listed as a 3 in 1 charger for iPhone, Apple Watch and earbuds but all this thing is is a stand. It doesn’t charge anything. You need three of your own cables and power cubes. It’s stupid and doesn’t work well.

Review.Titre: Your shipping is either too expensive…
Review.Contenu: Your shipping is either too expensive or too slow.
Am I missing something here? Everything I want is out of stock.
The computer is unusable as it came.  Could not set it up as there is some proprietary software still on the SSD!!!
SSD internal upgrade for 2009 27in iMac - thermal sensor replacement does not work. Fan runs continually. I’ve had the computer apart 3 times to check the installation.

Review.Titre: I’ve heard great things about OWC but…
Review.Contenu: I’ve heard great things about OWC and decided to purchase from them. Unfortunately my purchase of an external HDD enclosure and HDD needs to be RMA’d out of the box. I am glad there was an RMA offered but am very upset that this will be a 2 week+ process of shipping the old and new devices back and forth. This is on top of the week that it took to ship to me. Should I need a refurbished item in the future, OWC will not be the first place I will look.

Review.Titre: It is not that anything went 'wrong'…
Review.Contenu: It is not that anything went 'wrong' but that the product, the widgets to stabilize USB-C thunderbolt cables in the OWC T-bolt dock, seem terribly overpriced. That sense of being gouged, even though they do accomplish what they are made for, is made worse when one reminds oneself that the dock itself might have been designed better so that cables would stay securely connected without the extra help. Kind of thinking a pair of pants that won't stay up with either a belt or suspenders just have to have both to stay put, and that the suspenders (or belt) cost an arm and a leg, so to speak. No regrets on the purchase exactly, but since you ask me for this review, those thoughts come to mind.

Booting 1st. time gave startup screens for choosing language & time zones. Then came something about receiving administrative messages (like the computer was part of a distributed network). Subsequent screens revealed the operating system was set up as a part of the Yelp Company. Since it required an administrator to set up and I had none, I couldn't finish startup. I had to do an internet startup, erase the disk, and reinstall the operating system.So the product you sold me was not ready for sale.

Review.Titre: Configuration utility does not work on Mac with Sonoma.
Review.Contenu: The drive came pre-populated with binaries to configure the drive.  There was a binary for Windows users and one for Mac users.  When clicking on the Mac binary, it failed to work.  In the end I had to drop down to using the "diskutil" command line utility to format the drive for use.  This issue would have been a show stopper for a lot of people and probably caused returns.  This drive is connected to an M1 Mac mini via USB-C running Sonoma.

Having  inquired directly about the product I bought on a email , I then bought the  product , less than 48 hours later it had been drastically reduced . In future I would appreciate consideration in upcoming sales pricing . I always believe in paying a fair price for goods . As a FYI my review was responded to by OWC and i did not receive any discounts as stated in their response ,other than the initial purchase price

Review.Titre: Forced to engage with Customer Service because basic info not on purchase page.
Review.Contenu: I had to engage with Customer Service for 24 minutes to discover a basic fact that should have been included on the purchase page. Specifically, why would you include that fact that a one-year Apple warranty is included before the purchase page, and after, but not included that fact ON the purchase page?"Jeremy" answered, "Thank you for providing the screenshot. According to the identifier "UAOP2HS62XXX0XI," it does have the Apple 1 Year Limited Warranty. Regrettably, I'm not quite sure why it's not included on that part of the check out however, rest assured that it will have the warranty."Well, I'm not sure either. Do you want to explain to me why your bad order system design had to take 24 minutes out of my life?BTW, the "Date of experience is NOT, as this genius Trustpilot system says, 11/15/2023. It was on Nov 14, from roughly 7 - 7:25 p.m. Pacific (9 - 9:25 p.m. Central)

Review.Titre: Chat sales teams, just wants to upsell
Review.Contenu: That chat with the sales team was not good the wrong product was then purchased and I can not use it.   I have to pay for shipping back to the company, when I paid for shipping to the company for something that was not my fault.

If you are going to create automated email that gives me a link to check the status of my order, make sure that your claim is true and accurate. It's been 18 hours and I cannot see even that my order was received.When I ask for help and am told that there is a known problem with the Canadian website, I would think that nobody would need ME to point out that the thing to do is alter the email sent to Canadian customers. Or stop accepting orders from Canadian customers until the problem is fixed, because the loss of revenue would make the people who run the company realize how unacceptably bad their service has become.

Talk about unfriendly. Our billing address is a PO box.  We get all our mail and packages at the PO Box.  This is how we avoid mail thieves.  I had to get my son to help figure out how to buy his christmas present.  Most unsatisfactory!!!

The computer I purchased arrived with a cracked screen. There was absolutely no protection for the screen. Not even a sticker that said FRAGILE on the outside box. Whomever packaged my order needs some training on how to package a computer that is being shipped half way across the U.S.

Review.Titre: Buying something shouldn’t be this difficult ??
Review.Contenu: 04/12/2023 - UPDATE;Well I finally received the purchase which I made back in November 3rd.  Unfortunately of the 2 items I ordered, only 1 item delivered ??  2.0TB Aura Pro X2The other item paid for; * (512GB Apple Factory Original Solid-State Drive for Select 2013 and Later Mac Models. Apple factory original NVMe SSD for select MacBook Air,) - DID Not arrive in UPS delivery ??So OWC what in the hell is going on with your company’s dispatch department.  You have all my details regarding this order, and I have been talking to your Lucie S in order Verification, so I expect her or a supervisor to come back to me with an update and explanation ??  If that’s Not too much to ask if it ??There’s a well known saying which goes “there’s no second chance to make a first impression”Well I won’t go into any specific details just yet, but hope that someone from OWC is on the ball and reads this message and takes the time to investigate the matter and respond to me, as they OWC have all my details on file !!  However to make things easier I’ll quote OWC internal ref no: 02178928 L6676187-Q0001.It’s was a straight forward and simple sales transaction, which was turned into a Drama, so I’d suggest this is sorted out “tout de suite” and befit it descends into a crisis !! Compreende !!

Well, got my Envoy Pro FX 1TB external drive (SO-11903551), touted as the most compatible drive ever made; only to find out it does not have the ability to connect to my MacPro (Late 2013) and its older Thunderbolt connections. Nice looking SSD drive, but I want to connect via Thunderbolt to my computer.

Review.Titre: It was a little confusing on how to…
Review.Contenu: It was a little confusing on how to order the HomePods, It wasn't obvious on how to click and order, I had to search different web pages to get it done

Review.Titre: Not a full 1TB, and not the speeds they are saying
Review.Contenu: When you buy a 1 TB hard drive, its understandable if you need 1, maybe 2 GB for config or system files on the drive, but the Envoy Pro Elektron takes 40GB! Yes 40GB of drive space for system files AFTER you format the drive, Oh, and you MUST use the the drive formatter program that comes with the drive. It initially shows 8GB and you can format the drive, but it only makes it a 960GB drive?? After you use their proprietary formatter, you can reformat the drive with Mac Disk Utility, but still only 960GB?? Speed, using the USB-C on a Thunderbolt 4 Macbook pro M1 Max it only gets speeds of 490mb Read/write. Wayyyy below the advertised "up to" 1250MB/s speeds.

Dumb return policy. Returning is at your own expense. So it would cost me $18 to return a $24 charger, plus a 'restock fee'? Silly. They also require that they 'approve' your return before they even let you send it back. Their page states that "OWC's goal is to make the return process simple, hassle-free and speedy". Complete joke. Won't order here again.

I bought an Accelsior 1M2, 2TB for an upgrade to my MacPro 5.1. Your literature says that it is compatible with Mac OS 10.13.6, High Sierra. However it will not boot up from the 1M2, which has been cloned from my Mercury Ext Pro6G. Now tech support tells me that somewhere in the "fine print" that I really need 10.14 Mojave. What a damn waste of 2 days of my time because OWC  cannot publish the correct specs! Very upsetting.

Review.Titre: I received a really bad MacBook Pro
Review.Contenu: I received a really bad MacBook Pro. It has a corner that was bent from being dropped and the lid would not close all the way, I talked to a representative that said that this was just a cosmetic problem and that’s the way they ship products and no guarantee that if I exchanged it that the next one would be better.. I would not have the nerve to sell anything in this shape.

Not really the sales persons fault, but I received an inauthentic charger and the person I talked to had no way to prove to me it was real and I think very unfair that if the product is opened I have to pay to send it back and a restocking fee! I had to open it it’ll to see they it was fake… he didn’t offer me any work around given the situation.

Review.Titre: There hasn’t been any follow up…
Review.Contenu: There hasn’t been any follow up information regarding my purchase(s)!No tracking number or information as to the order status.  It has been over ten business days and no word on where my orders are.I’m getting that sinking feeling that despite the initial message that the orders were filled and are on the way, my purchases are gone…..Pretty poor follow up.

The use of gift cards to provide product discount is horrible.You offer a $250 gift card when buying a Macbook pro, then charge for the gift card. Just charge what you're going to charge. Don't obfuscate your charges.Be honest up front. Don't fool your customers and shock them with an unexpected charge. This is a dirty trick. If this continues, this will be the LAST product I buy from you.

Review.Titre: Owc Enclosure failed out of the box
Review.Contenu: Its is a inconvenience to purchased a enclosure and have it fail right out of the box. Raid 0 will not format two identical ssd's.. But under individual setting I see both drives, set the raid to 0 and it will not work. Hold time is ridiculous for support 10mins already.

Disappointing performance.  Expected SSD read/write speeds not listed on product sales page; had to dig into background material after purchase to find it.  Only supported an SSD transferring data at 20% of memory rated speed despite Thunderbolt 4 connection.  Heck of a disappointment!

Review.Titre: Website doesn’t reload items if you cancel and reorder
Review.Contenu: Purchased a laptop with the wrong shipping/billing address, so I canceled the order to place it again. The item continues to say “no longer available” even though I bought it just minutes prior. Surprising that the process of refunding and re-listing the item is not automatic. Customer service was unable to help.

So it was 10 days without any updated information. I called support to find out what the hold up was and two days later I got an email saying that they should have the order out today. So 12 days to get information on an order, not good..I haven’t received the item yet so hopefully all is well.

2 stars because I've purchased before with no problems. Now they sold me an SSD drive, they knew over a year before they sold it to me, that it causes laptop crashes. All this time I thought it was something I was doing so I never asked for tech support but when I contacted Apple, it turns out it's the OWC memory who's crashing my laptop! It's under warranty but they already blame Apple so they told me that when I return it they'll bench test it & they'll send it back to me. How does that solve the problem where they incorrectly designed their SSD drives to need more voltage than the Apple laptop supplies?
Crazy postal service price. Only one service, UPS. Why? To deliver small pieces of memory? I got memory inside of small evenlope by ordinary post. And it cost just some euros.

Overall product quality is hit or miss.  Two out of threeexternal disk enclosures have failed; one was used lightly yet failed about six months after warranty expiration.  I am trying one more time, partly because I already have several spare parts for those items.  Be wary of OWC brand products.

Review.Titre: An apparent degradation of customer service.
Review.Contenu: You can answer my emails. That would be a start. I guess that I’m on my own about figuring out what to do about a MacBook Pro that was shipped with the wrong operating system. 24 hours for answering emails is, apparently, a pretty loose standard - it seems to me more like 48 or maybe 72 hours if you get an answer at all. This used to be a very responsive company. I don’t know what happened but it’s not very responsive anymore.

Never received a shipping confirmation, even after my online chat session. The IPhone SE 1st generation was advertised as the last one you had @ $89.00. Then after I purchased the phone you had another one, identical specs for $79.00. The phone was in excellent condition, I’m glad I purchased it.

your website sucks.  It is only helpful to the extent it appears obvious a sale is pending.  It provides information only when you think it makes a sale.  Learn a lesson from Amazon..... that is, you can never give a possible customer too much data.

Review.Titre: The part itself was fine but UPS SurePost leaves a lot to be desired.
Review.Contenu: The part itself was fine, but the UPS SurePost was both pricey and wonky.  The item was not delivered on the date promised, and tracking with USPS claimed they attempted delivery and left a note saying I could pick it up at post office other than my local post office.  I was home all day, and there was no delivery either at my door or in my mailbox and no note to be found anywhere.  Diving into the USPS Tracking website, I requested delivery the next day. The item ended up in regular delivery in my mailbox the next day, suggesting the information from the USPS tracking service was fundamentally inoperative and misleading.  Bottom line is that UPS SurePost is wonky, with USPS operating in a manner inconsistent with what UPS promises.

Well, I was perfectly happy with just buying the 2 cards that I bought but I kept getting an ad for what i thought was a cf express reader since that's what i was buying but when it came in, it was some cf reader that I've never seen or used before. CFast or something. Why would they show me a sales ad from my cart with something that has no relevant value to what i was buying. I'm now out some $$$ and not gonna waste my time or more money to send it back. Not extremely happy with my shopping experience which sucks because I really like your products.

Check out was buggy.The website would display one price and then I would add to cart the price would change.This happened on multiple itemsIf I hadn’t been paying attention then I could easily see being over charged.Perplexed I checked multiple different browsers and they all exhibited this behavior.  Some of the browsers even displayed items that were unavailable in other browsers.I eventually settled on an item but it was not my first, second or even third pick.  It was an item that simply didn’t perform an unadvertised price increase when I added it to cart.

Review.Titre: After I set up my newly purchased used…
Review.Contenu: After I set up my newly purchased used iMac computer I contacted you to let you know that the unit was performing in an unusually sluggish manner. Even getting the screen to wake up out of sleep mode would take 5 or more seconds. OWC represented the purchase as coming with a warranty but your response when I brought this issue to your attention was "go talk to Apple". The computer has continued to perform slower and more erratically in the 6 months I've owned it to the point I'm going to have to find a replacement. Totally unacceptable. This was a very disappointing first time experience of purchasing a used computer from OWC and I doubt I will do it again.

Review.Titre: The products were good the technical…
Review.Contenu: The products were good the technical support and after the sale needs improvement. I chatted with a person who said he was with technical support he could not resolve my issue. I went to YouTube and searched and found a person who within a few minutes of listening to him explain how to resolve my issue it was resolved

Review.Titre: I ordered a mac pro with 32g of ram
Review.Contenu: I ordered a mac pro with 32g of ram, received it, works fine but only 28 gig of ram in the machine... I have to send it back ... as i'm a canadian the delays are awfull and i will be forced to delay my projects. I also made an order on canadian site and i cannot acces my order in my account, i tried to contact support, they transfered my to canadian support, and i've got no more reply to my messages.  I bought at OWC instead of a used one in order to simplify the process...But it is more complicated... I would not recommend for canadian custumers

Review.Titre: When I went to check out my purchase
Review.Contenu: When I went to check out my purchase, I encountered a screen that went nowhere with no explanation. I finally figured it out as I am a retired IBMer with many IT skills. Great idea, but it needs some work.  How do you attach them? Seems pretty straightforward but that's where the problems begin.  I have an OWC Thunderbolt 4 hub purchased earlier this year, along with OWC Thunderbolt 4 cables.  I had to velcro down the wires to keep them connected.  I'm not faulting the hub or the cables, that's just the way they are. The cables, being only 0.3m long need to be laid out straight coming from the hub. If you curve them,  the will have a little bit of "spring" to them, and if the hub gets bumped, you could loose your connection.   The velcro worked, sort of.  I thought the Clingon sounded great so I bought 5.  Now, to attach them, do you peel the backing off, center it as best you can and press?  There's no turning back at that point.  Either it's centered or not.  The adhesive is like a very thin auto body trim tape, so it's super sticky.  Next I tried to push the Thunderbolt 4 cable through the Clingon attached to the hub.  It's a very tight fit. There's very little tolerance for a misaligned Clingon to accept a Thunderbolt 4 cable, and to allow it to make a good connection.  I ended up removing the Clingon, removing the adhesive and just using the locking pin to keep it in place.  Not ideal, but still, since the cable is such a tight fit in the Clingon, it still prevents a lot of wobble with just the locking pin attached.Now my story doesn't end there, that was just the first cable.  Next I tried to slip the Clingon over the cable before attaching it to the Thunderbolt 4 hub.  With this method, you have a choice.  Peel the adhesive cover after you insert the cable or before.  I chose before, in the end, it didn't matter because either way, when the connector body exits through the Clingon, it only takes a slight misalignment of the sticky tape to cause the cable to push against a tiny bit of the tape and attach itself to your very expensive (but worth the price) cable.  Without realizing this you may blindly think you finally have a handle on this installation thing. But you may have just contaminated your very expensive (but also worth it) hub with auto body tape.   In the end, I stripped the adhesive off the Clingons and only used the locking pin.  Still better than the velcro!

Then when checked on availability, then told that replacement is not available. Offered discount. Then when asked how much, was offered USD 100. On the web-site, the delta between Used Good vs. Used Very Good is USD 200+. So OWC still making a profit on a product issue. Offered return and refund. Shipped as two boxes (computer box plus separate keyboard and mouse). Only given one shipping label. Asked for second shipping label. Told use bigger box. Explained that I am using original packaging with OWC shipping as two boxes. Told that I can use the same label for both boxes. The issued label states 1 of 1. I expect UPS to reject two boxes. I explained this to OWC but no reply. Customer Service is frustrating.

Petty attitude, I know and it was my fault, but they made no effort to make me a satisfied customer, I make no effort to be a loyal customer.
